sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The anatomist anatomis'd. Or, a short answer to some things in the book, intituled, An anatomy of independencie: wherein it's shewed; I. That many things reported are mis-reported. II. That if all were true, yet divulging of them in this manner, is not according to the word of God. III. Nor argumentative against the cause that's falsly called independency. By Sidr. Simpson. Simpson, Sidrach, 1600?-1655.
12 p.
Printed for Peter Cole, at the Royall Exchange, London : 1644.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 28th". A reply to: Forbes, Alexander. Anatomy of independency (Wing F1439). Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
